name: The Mosser

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Small but very well appointed hotel. Very clean hotel with recent remodeling.
reviews.title: Loved The Mosser

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed there for a weekend get-a-way as a result of the Hotel sending me and email stating reduced rates for specific dates. We love going to SF, so anytime we can go - we go.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: The location is outstanding! We never had our car brought out from the valet parking.
reviews.title: Loved This Place!!!!!!!!
Great Location
reviews.text: Walked to the Metreon to see The Titianic exhibit which was wonderful. Walked to The Ferry Building one evening to enjoy the boats coming/going out. Walked to the Castro and enjoyed a wonderful meal at Chow on Church.
Really loved the location and hotel. Only complaint would be that it was a bit noisy, however this is the City.
reviews.title: Underwhelming, even for the hotel class

likes.disliked: — the actual accomodation, bare bones service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: San Francisco is an expensive city to stay. Knowing this, it is fair to say that the Mosser hotel is good value for money as the rooms are spotless, wel designed and modern. There is also a big ceiling fan (varriable speed) which is really handy to circulate the air in this tiny room! Its location is also very central: litterally 3 seconds walk from the main street with trams to the piers and the Powell line going over the hills!
reviews.title: Small but clean and central

likes.liked: — Central location and good looking rooms
likes.disliked: — The small size of the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My brother-in-law recommended this hotel and already told us that the rooms were really small, so we knew what to expect. We prefered the shared toilet/bathroom option to save a bit of money, and thought it was a good option as we never met anyone in the corridors and the toilets/bathrooms were really clean and always free!
reviews.title: Good choice

reviews.text: So, in summary, if you don't want backpackers style hotels but don't want to splash out either, I would recommend the Mosser.
reviews.title: good value

likes.disliked: — Narrow stairs, no sink in bathroom, fire alarm

reviews.text: The only downside, was that we had view onto the back of the hotel where some contruction/building work were going on. Not best for the noise, but that's more bad luck/timing than the hotels fault itself.
reviews.title: friendly with little rooms
What are your expectations?
reviews.text: We stayed in the Mosser for three nights the room was very clean and trendy. The room was small but perfectly adequate. The bed was very comfortable. We got a much better rate for the room by booking online so reccomend booking in advance.
PRIME location, impeccable, charming hotel...LOVED it!!
reviews.title: Elegance in a PRIME location...

likes.liked: — Impeccably charming in a prime location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful period hotel newly updated and renovated provides the supreme tourist experience. I loved every aspect about this hotel. I travel primarily in Europe so am accustomed to shared bath/toilet. A small but incrediblly efficient room which was loaded with so many extras...small cable T.V. ceiling fan, sink with free manufacturers samples, internet/TV, alarm clock in T.V., CD player/radio/alarm clock, terrycloth robes, coffee/muffins for breakfast in lobby, telephone, IKEA type bed which was very comfortable, lovely pillows/bedspread, quality fabric. Just steps away from the BART/MUNI and shopping galore. Very safe location which is well lit and well traveled. I can't wait to return to THE MOSSER HOTEL!!
reviews.title: Good value stay
Brilliant value
reviews.text: Only ended up staying the night as our flight was delayed into Chicago and we missed our connection. Room was small but htere was just enough room for the 2 of us plus 2 large suitcases. Although due to the lack of hanging space you couldn't stay longer than a few days. Location was excellent and the room was clean and compactly furnished. Plus the price was spot on compared to other hotels we had priced.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a deal - $99/night for a twin bed room with ensuite bathroom in the center of SF. I'd call it a boutique hotel in that it is nicely renovated and has lots of charm. The staff were friendly and efficient, the rooms tidy and nicely decorated. I'll be staying here again.
reviews.title: Excellent in almost every respect.

reviews.text: First of all, The Mosser is not for everyone. If you are a traveler who enjoys amenities like a pool/spa, exercise facility, room service, or if you prefer to stay in suites or upgraded rooms, The Mosser really isn't what you're looking for. There are many hotels in the same area that are more in this vein, and you would be better off going with them.
reviews.title: Pristine Excellence at The Mosser

likes.liked: — Great location, excellent, knowledgable staffing, comfortable rooms

reviews.title: Small but cute.
reviews.text: In terms of value, The Mosser is a great deal. It's in an attractive building, staff are very friendly and helpful (except for the guy who refused to give me quarters for the laundry because he was running low), and rooms are smartly done. I would not recommend this hotel to people who like large rooms or who are traveling with large amounts of luggage. There is nowhere to put your things. The sink in our room was inside the bedroom, with the toilet and shower in a separate room. A good space saver. But this is definitely the tiniest room I've ever been in in a hotel. Location is great. Nothing much to see in the area, but it's a good central location to get to other neighborhoods. I would stay here again.

reviews.title: Style and Substance... Convenient, too!
reviews.text: I stayed with the folks at the Mosser for almost a week, and they were just wonderful. My friend and I stayed in a king suite with an extra room, and it was perfect for everything we needed as twenty-somethings wanting to see the city.

reviews.title: Expensive Parking of $28.00
reviews.text: I'd stayed here once before in a smaller room, alone, but both times I was greeted warmly, checked in quickly, and never really had issues with anything else (except the elevator, which has to be a million years old... which is to say, I tolerated the elevator as I tolerate close-talkers and mouth-breathers... you just have to). The first time, the gentleman at the desk (Mark?) gave me some free passes to see the sights so I could get to adventure a little and still stay on budget.
SF is a noisy city, so if you aren't used to it, bring your ear plugs.
reviews.title: perfect location for convention center but no frills
Excellent Choice!
reviews.text: Great access to BART and other public transportation.

reviews.title: Great Place to stay on a budget!
reviews.text: I stayed at the Mosser for 3 nights towards the end of April. We arrived to the hotel quite late from the East coast - so we were exhausted. The hotel staff were friendly and accomadating. They provided us with maps - that we used first thing in the morning. The hotel lobby was art deco and the style fit the mood of the hotel. The building is from the 1920's, but recently renovated.

This was my budget choice. So we chose a room with a full bed and the bathroom was a shared facility on the floor. The room was tiny... but really all the space you need for a few day stay. The space of the room allowed for the full bed, a sink, small closet, and a little stand in the corner. That's it. But again, very clean and well decorated. A quaint European feel. There were 2 restrooms on the floor and 2 showers. Never had an issue with using any of the facilities. (If I were to do it again - I would chose a room with a bathroom - but I did save a lot of money. )
reviews.title: Small but good value, great location

reviews.text: Hotel was in the perfect location. Right off of Market street on 4th. Near public transportation, tons of shopping, and eateries.
reviews.title: Awful excuse for a boutique hotel
Loved the Mosser
reviews.text: Only complaint about the stay is that our sink leaked in the room. So we used the trash can to catch the water.

reviews.title: Noisy, bad service, tiny rooms
reviews.text: Great hotel on a budget. Definately recommendable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I recently visited San Francisco and stayed at the Mosser. It's nicely located near Union Square, the F line to Fisherman's Warf and airport transporation. Although the rooms are small (think European hostel), they make up for it with a modern look and welcome bag (gum, toothpaste, shampoo and conditioner, free CD). The showers/bathrooms are down the hall (think European hostel again) but you are supplied with a bath robe and towels.
reviews.title: Great Deal for the $

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One thing I found interesting was that the Mosser uses a portion of it's hotel proceeds to replant trees (over 5 million already). Even if you're not a tree hugger, it's nice to know that someone cares enough about an issue to make that sort of effort.
reviews.title: Mosser is great

likes.disliked: — Took us a minute to figure out the fancy tv remote

reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service from the Reservations Department
reviews.text: I pride myself on finding good travel deals and traveling on a budget (even though I don't have to). This is a great deal for the area (approx $90 after taxes for a queen bed for two). If Rick Steves wrote travel books for the US, I'm sure the Mosser would be on his list.

Such a cute hotel! When my boyfriend and I checked in during a trip the previous August, we were a little alarmed at the small room size at first; we're both used to family vacations, packing 7 people into the HoJo. It only took us a second to realize what a great hotel we had chosen - sophisticated, nicely furnished/decorated, little touches. Very cool artwork and a fantastic view of downtown San Fran. Awesome location on Market and 4th. We returned for my birthday the following February and didn't even check any other hotels. The restaurant/bar downstairs (the Annabelle, I believe) is a great late-night drinking spot whether or not you're staying in the hotel (there are several nearby, but we didn't find any other good bars). Make sure you get a "deluxe" room though - otherwise it's a community bathroom in the hall! Deluxe rooms are only marginally more expensive, and unless you're cool with dorm living, I would suggest it.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also - concierge was wonderfully accommodating, The first trip we drove from Nevada and had to park my boyfriend's car somewhere; the hotel had a parking lot and totally took care of it. We flew in for our second stay and they locked our luggage in the back for us after we checked out so we could continue to enjoy the city. Unless you're going to San Fran with the express purpose of sitting around in your hotel room all day, the Mosser is a great night's stay!
reviews.title: Wow!!!

likes.liked: — The smart use of small spaces and the modern decor.

reviews.text: My husband and I went with another couple and were very happy with our stay. The Mosser is a Euro-style hotel, but we were fortunate to get an in-room bath. Although I peeked in the shared bathrooms and they weren't bad, just small.
reviews.title: Classy on a dime

likes.disliked: — No room service, but downstairs restaurant is very good.

reviews.text: Some unique features of our stay were: A beautiful flower arrangement on our bed that greeted us when we walked in, a book containing the the philanthropic aspects of the hotel (yay!), a bag contaning sample projects (toothpaste, nice lotions, face scrub and a Harelquin Romance Novel- HA!). Also, suicide windows to keep out the noise below.
reviews.title: location, location, location

reviews.text: The location is GREAT!!! I can't even emphasize this enough. Its right off market, a quick walk to Chinatown and Little Italy.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Mosser

likes.disliked: — Small room size and breakfast muffins!

reviews.text: Some things people may not like is the very tiny TV in the corner top portion of the room. Also, someone got shot down the street. Like, on the next block. It was all blocked off, so it was hectic, but the hotel staff was very honest about it and didn't make it a big issue. Really odd, its normally a safe area!
reviews.title: Web site is nothing like what you actually get, think fraud

likes.disliked: — Web site is nothing like the real thing, think fraud. Hotel staff and management don't care.

reviews.title: Very Impressed
reviews.text: Anyways, we loved it so much, I just booked our next trip to SF in December, and we are staying at the Mosser again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and i stayed at the Mosser this past weekend in September and had a lovely time. We wanted to go cheap so we did the queen with a shared bathroom. If you decide to do this as well, make sure you get a room that is higher in digits (224 as opposed to 201) because the lower the number the closer you are to the stairs which can be noisy. The rooms are clean but small, the staff is friendly and the bathrooms were never occupied when i needed to use it. The location of this hotel is fantastic!!! We didnt rent a car at all and were able to walk to China Town, the shopping district, the museum, clubs etc. Would stay again!!
reviews.title: Great Value Awesome Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay here tremendously. The staff was intuitively accommodating, and very friendly. The rooms are quaint, but efficient, and shouldn't hinder your stay unless you are planning a long (week +) vacation (no dressers, but they have a closet).
reviews.title: Highly Recommend

reviews.text: There are a lot of places, number-wise and geographically, to stay. This I have to mention, because we broke our trip up throughout the city, was probably one of the best for location, and absolutely for price. The restaurant, Annabelle's, was fabulous especially when we were too tired to go too far.
reviews.title: LOCATION ONLY

likes.liked: — room was clean, staff seem to clean more than other places

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall the beds are super comfy, the entire hotel was very clean, and the decor along with the hand sketched art are a nice personal touch. Plus it was less than 50 yards to Market St. and all of the fun stuff downtown.
reviews.title: We would go back in a heartbeat!
Very cute, clean, great location!
reviews.text: We have a lot of places to visit, but if we ever go back to San Fran I would love to stay again at the Mosser and support them and their environmental research mission.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If location is what you are looking for - this is it!!!! It is across the street from the Marriott and 2 doors down from the Palomar. It is a short hop to everywhere you want to be! BART is around the corner. The other reviews about the size of the rooms is correct. One person max is all the space the room has. This is small even by San Francisco standards.
reviews.title: Perfect for a night in the city

description: Conveniently located between the city's renowned Union Square and the Moscone Convention Center, both business and leisure travelers will find excellent shopping, dining, touring and nightlife within blocks from their hotel.
